Geographically, Aguilas benefits from its position approximately 140km south of Alicante Airport and 90km from Almeria, making it accessible yet relatively undeveloped compared to overcrowded coastal alternatives. The Mediterranean climate delivers 320+ sunny days annually, with mild winters and warm summers—ideal for year-round tourism and outdoor living. The town has undergone selective modernization while preserving its traditional fishing village charm, reflected in the waterfront promenades, local markets, and family-run restaurants. Its position between two provinces (Murcia and Andalusia) creates unique economic advantages, attracting investors seeking emerging markets before major development occurs.

faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-EU and EU foreigners enjoy identical property purchase rights as Spanish citizens. No residency requirements exist for property ownership. British, American, Dutch, Scandinavian, and other nationalities routinely purchase properties throughout Spain. Professional legal representation simplifies the process and protects buyer interests throughout the transaction.

faqs.question: What are the typical costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Total acquisition costs typically range 8-12% of property price, including: transfer tax (6-11% depending on autonomous community), notary fees (0.5-1%), land registry (0.1-0.5%), legal fees (1%), and property administration registration (0.1%). A €323,000 property would incur approximately €26,000-€39,000 in total costs. These expenses are one-time charges, distinct from annual ownership costs.

faqs.question: What are property taxes in Spain like?
faqs.answer: Annual property ownership costs include: IBI (municipal property tax) averaging €200-€400 annually in Aguilas, and community fees (if applicable) of €100-€200 monthly. Capital gains tax applies only when property sells at profit. These recurring costs remain substantially lower than UK council tax and property fees, enhancing net rental yield.

faqs.question: Могу ли я получить ипотеку в Испании как иностранец?
faqs.answer: Yes, major Spanish banks routinely finance foreign property buyers at 60-80% loan-to-value ratios. Interest rates range 2.5-4% for competitive borrowers. Documentation requirements include proof of income, credit history evaluation, and property valuation. Mortgage processes typically complete within 30-45 days. Currency consideration applies—euro mortgages eliminate exchange rate exposure for long-term investors.
